main event: A report was filed regarding an unidentified object observed in Richland, Washington on 15 July 1953.
interesting points: The report was classified as 'Information Only' and contained no definitive conclusions,There was a focus on the difficulty in verifying the incident due to the time elapsed between observation and report,The object was described as shiny and circular, initially appearing like a bright star,Reports indicated that the object moved in an erratic manner and eventually disappeared,There were multiple sightings reported in July 1953 evaluating various potential explanations such as balloons and meteors.
witness description: two employees observed the object for approximately 30 to 60 seconds
